page.title: 06EDUCATION IN NEWTOWN AREA
page.content: The majority of children in the grid area will attend Newtown School from 5-8 years, Droxford School from 8-11 years and Swanmore (Comprehensive) School from 11-16 years. The designated college for higher education is at Eastleigh and there are further education colleges at Fareham, Eastleigh and Cosham. Children who do not live within Newtown parish follow a slightly different pattern. Newtown's catchment also covers an area outside of the grid. In 1985 three teachers taught 60 pupils, one third of whom came from outside the catchment area because of the school's good name. The school day lasts from 9 to 3.15, with 2 playtime breaks. School lunches, cooked at Droxford School, are eaten by about half the pupils, the rest have packed lunch.
